intro: Dolicholobium leptocarpum, commonly known as the slender-fruited dolicholobium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated fruits and hairy stems. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
